t: Lord,*spn hear a just cause; pay*ln attention to my cry; listen*ln to my prayer — from*ln lips free of deceit.
Let*ln my vindication come from you, for*ln you see what is right.
You*ln have tested my heart; you*ln have examined me at night. You*ln have tried me and found nothing evil; I*ln have determined that my mouth will not sin.
Concerning*ln what people do: by*ln the words from your lips I*ln have avoided the ways of the violent.
My*ln steps are on your paths; my*ln feet have not slipped.
I*pn call on you, God, because*ln you will answer me; listen*ln closely to me; hear what I say.
Display*ln the wonders of your faithful love, Savior*ln of all who seek refuge from*ln those who rebel against your right hand.
Protect*ln me as the pupil of your eye; hide*ln me in the shadow of your wings
from*ln the wicked who treat me violently, my*ln deadly enemies who surround me.
They*pn are uncaring; their*ln mouths speak arrogantly.
They*ln advance against me; now they surround me. They*ln are determined to*ln throw me to the ground.
They*ln are like a lion eager to tear, like*ln a young lion lurking in ambush.
Rise*pn up, Lord!*s Confront*ln him; bring him down. With*ln your sword, save me from the wicked.

With*ln your hand, Lord,*s save me from men, from*ln men of the world whose*ln portion is in this life: You*ln fill their bellies with what you have in store; their*ln sons are satisfied, and*ln they leave their surplus to their children.
But*pn I will see your face in righteousness; when*ln I awake, I will be satisfied with your presence.
